# Analysis of ğŸ’»â”‚developers Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. 3rdEyeVisuals mentioned updating UIVideo to respect UI RenderOrder and adding an option to remove transparency from UI element containers, while keeping videos behind the root UI to prevent visual distraction. There was a brief discussion about npm audit fixes, with 3rdEyeVisuals cautioning against using --force as it could break dependencies. A user (ğŸ†‚ğŸ…´ğŸ…±ğŸ…¶ğŸ…°) asked about integrating Eliza into their 3D world, but received limited guidance. .hyp shaman mentioned using bun locally and reminded users to set their .env.local file. The conversation also briefly touched on 3rdEyeVisuals' interest in experimenting with splatting technology. Overall, the chat was relatively sparse with technical details and consisted mostly of brief updates and questions.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Where and how should I import an app like Eliza into the code so I can use it in my 3D world? (asked by ğŸ†‚ğŸ…´ğŸ…±ğŸ…¶ğŸ…°) A: If the Eliza framework is not already integrated into the backend of Hyperfy framework then it will be a lot more complex than just plug and play with the repo. (answered by 3rdEyeVisuals)
Q: Just create elisa folder in src and clone the repo? (asked by ğŸ†‚ğŸ…´ğŸ…±ğŸ…¶ğŸ…°) A: Unanswered
Q: Is it really important to do npm audit fix (without --force)? Any security risk for later in world? (asked by ğŸ†‚ğŸ…´ğŸ…±ğŸ…¶ğŸ…°) A: If you --force updates to your packages you could actually break things. Need to be careful there. Some dependencies only play nice with certain versions of other dependencies. (answered by 3rdEyeVisuals)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: .hyp shaman | Helpee: Channel members | Context: Environment setup reminder | Resolution: Reminded users to set their .env.local file
Helper: 3rdEyeVisuals | Helpee: ğŸ†‚ğŸ…´ğŸ…±ğŸ…¶ğŸ…° | Context: Question about npm audit fix --force | Resolution: Warned about potential dependency breakage when forcing updates
Helper: 3rdEyeVisuals | Helpee: ğŸ†‚ğŸ…´ğŸ…±ğŸ…¶ğŸ…° | Context: Integrating Eliza into 3D world | Resolution: Explained it would be complex if not already integrated into Hyperfy backend

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Update UIVideo to respect UI RenderOrder | Description: Added option to remove UI element container transparency while keeping video behind root UI | Mentioned By: 3rdEyeVisuals
Technical: Experiment with splatting technology | Description: 3rdEyeVisuals expressed interest in exploring this technique | Mentioned By: 3rdEyeVisuals

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion, primarily focused on brief exchanges about Hyperfy features and potential implementations. Agent12 inquired about creating notification zones in Hyperfy V2 similar to "Collider with Notifications" from V1, seeking ways to track user movements and potentially send notifications to Discord. Valiant suggested a possible solution by referencing a previous Discord message. There was also a brief discussion about using rolling ball physics as a workaround for implementing vehicles in Hyperfy V2, with Agent12 noting someone had already built a "Time Trial" tool. Akuma suggested adding a toggle for right analog stick camera movement. The conversation was casual with several "good morning" greetings and minimal technical depth.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Would it be possible to toggle on a right analog stick for camera movement instead of using screen? (asked by Akuma) A: Unanswered
Q: Does anyone have simple V2 .hyps that might function like "Collider with Notifications" from V1? (asked by Agent12) A: Valiant suggested checking a previously shared Discord message that might help
Q: Could "Rolling Ball as the Actual Car" Physics be a super-quick workaround for Usable Vehicles in Hyperfy V2? (asked by Agent12) A: 3rdEyeVisuals confirmed "Yup!"

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Valiant | Helpee: Agent12 | Context: Agent12 needed a way to create notification zones in Hyperfy V2 similar to V1's "Collider with Notifications" | Resolution: Valiant shared a Discord message link that might contain a solution

## 4. Action Items
Feature: Right analog stick toggle for camera movement | Description: Add option to use right analog stick for camera control instead of screen | Mentioned By: Akuma
Feature: Notification zone system for V2 | Description: Create collider zones that trigger chat events when users enter them | Mentioned By: Agent12
Feature: Discord integration for world events | Description: System to send world events directly to Discord rather than just world chat | Mentioned By: Agent12
Technical: Implement rolling ball physics for vehicles | Description: Use rolling ball physics as a workaround for implementing usable vehicles in Hyperfy V2 | Mentioned By: Agent12
